content.query:
-- Create a stored procedure for storing the scoring script.
CREATE PROCEDURE [ML].[StoreProcedurePred]
AS
BEGIN
-- Select input scoring data and assign aliases.
WITH InputData AS
(
    SELECT
        TOP 1
        CAST([CustomerID] AS [varchar]) AS [CustomerID],
        CAST([CurrentLoanAmount] AS [bigint]) AS [CurrentLoanAmount],
        CAST([Term] AS [varchar]) AS [Term],
        [CreditScore],
        [AnnualIncome],
        CAST([Yearsincurrentjob] AS [varchar]) AS [Yearsincurrentjob],
        CAST([HomeOwnership] AS [varchar]) AS [HomeOwnership],
        CAST([Purpose] AS [varchar]) AS [Purpose],
        [MonthlyDebt],
        [YearsofCreditHistory],
        [Monthssincelastdelinquent],
        CAST([NumberofOpenAccounts] AS [bigint]) AS [NumberofOpenAccounts],
        CAST([NumberofCreditProblems] AS [bigint]) AS [NumberofCreditProblems],
        CAST([CurrentCreditBalance] AS [bigint]) AS [CurrentCreditBalance],
        [MaximumOpenCredit],
        [Bankruptcies],
        [TaxLiens]
    FROM [ML].[loans_test]
)
-- Using T-SQL Predict command to score machine learning models. 
SELECT *
FROM PREDICT (MODEL = (SELECT [model] FROM [ML].[predictions] WHERE [ID] = 'demosynapsest-loans_training-20220310041342-Best:1'),
              DATA = InputData,
              RUNTIME = ONNX) WITH ([prediction] [varchar], [probabity] [real])
END
GO

-- Execute the above stored procedure.
EXEC [ML].[StoreProcedurePred]
